title: Can I publish very small photo of the famous person in the book (purpose is information) without permission? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. The photographer owns a copyright on their photo. You need permission to use it. You are probably asking about the celebrity's permission. Here you don't need that. Personality Rights over the use of your image block use in promotion of s product, cause, or organization without or permission. But don't ban other uses. But you still need the owner of the photo to give permission.

Not unless it’s fair use. Find out who owns the copyright. What I do is go to Wiki Commons - most of their photographs are fair use (meaning not copyrighted) - but check the picture before you use it because occasionally there are restrictions.

You will need the permission of the owner of the photograph (may not be the photographer). You almost certainly don’t need the permission of the subject of the photo. As ever, it’ll depend on the local rules on image rights and copyright in the territory where you wish to publish.
Do you own the rights to the photo? If so, then yes. If not, then you need to get permission from the person who owns the photo.
